original: Nibbānaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ parāyanaṁ accutaṁ amatanti?
analyzed: nibbānam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam parāyanam accutam
translated: Is Nibbāna a refuge, a haven, a shelter, a final relief, the unchangeable, the undying?
Is predestination unconditioned, and is Nibbāna unconditioned?

original: Dve tāṇāni dve leṇāni dve saraṇāni dve parāyanāni dve accutāni dve amatāni dve nibbānānīti?
analyzed: dve tāṇāni dve leṇāni dve saraṇāni dve parāyanāni dve accutāni dve amatāni dve nibbānāni iti
translated: Are there two refuges, two havens, two shelters, two final reliefs, two unchangeables, two undyings, two Nibbānas?

original: Atthi dvinnaṁ nibbānānaṁ uccanīcatā hīnapaṇītatā ukkaṁsāvakaṁso sīmā vā bhedo vā rāji vā antarikā vāti?
analyzed: atthi dvinnam nibbānānam ucca nīca tā hīna paṇīta tā ukkasa avakasaḥ sīmā vā bhedaḥ vā rāji vā antarikā vā ati
translated: Is there a high and a low, an inferior and a superior, a far and a near, a division or a crack or a seam in the two Nibbānas?

original: Atthi keci niyāmaṁ okkamanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhāpenti samuṭṭhāpenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanentīti?
analyzed: atthi keci niyāmam okkamanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhāpenti samuṭṭhāpenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanenti iti
translated: Are there any who enter upon and emerge from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling?

original: Atthi keci asaṅkhataṁ okkamanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhāpenti samuṭṭhāpenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanentīti?
analyzed: atthi keci asaṅkhatam okkamanti paṭilabhanti uppādenti samuppādenti uṭṭhāpenti samuṭṭhāpenti nibbattenti abhinibbattenti janenti sañjanenti iti
translated: “Are there any who enter upon and emerge from the unformed?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fixed course of the stream-enterer unformed?”
“Is the path of the stream-enterer unformed?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the path of the stream-enterer formed?”
“Is the fixed course of the stream-enterer formed?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the fixed course of the once-returner …
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the course leading to arahantship formed?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“Is the course leading to stream-entry unformed? …
Is the course leading to arahantship unformed? Is Nibbāna unformed?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Are there five shelters, five places to stay, five abodes, five kinds of delight, and five kinds of craving?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  na vattabba

original: Niyāme uppajja niruddhe aniyato hotīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: niyāme uppajja niruddhe aniyataḥ hoti iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “When one arises and ceases in the course, does one become unformed?”🔽“No.”
“Then you should not say that the course is unformed.”

analyzed: micchat ta niyāme uppajja niruddhe aniyataḥ hoti iti
translated: When he has arisen and ceased in the wrong true way, is he indeterminate?”
“Well then, the wrong true way is unformed.”
The Discussion of the True Ways is finished.
